Greetings!


In a strange loop of events, you are about to read an introduction that has no choice but to refer to itself. I am a Postdoctoral Researcher in Computer Science at KU Leuven. I work at the intersection of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Security, with expertise in all things Adversarial Machine Learning and Reinforcement Learning.

My research spans the theoretical and practical aspects of adversarial attacks and defenses across a broad range of systems and modalities. I've broken Google reCaptcha v3 by leveraging its scoring mechanism as feedback to train undetectable web automation. I successfully led a project in collaboration with UCL, KCL, and Avast, developing a novel approach to harden the AI module of Avast antivirus against adversarial malware. The crux of my research journey however, is the creation of a general framework that rigorously evaluates the correct functioning of any deployed AI model. Specifically, by adaptively optimizing attacks and defenses within competitive game they form, this framework systematically exposes vulnerabilities, allowing them to be identified and corrected.

More generally, I explore the fundamentals of robust learning and its adversarial and counterfactual facets as essential components in achieving trustworthy and safe AI. As human decision-making increasingly transitions to automated, I am developing new techniques and methodologies for training models resilient to evasion and other failure modes. Currently, I investigate safeguarding LLMs through the integration of alignment, guardrails, and other defenses to ensure safe and correct outputs in real-world deployments.

However, my aspirations do not end with practical methods for robustness. Towards general and safe AI, my research endeavors to prevent reward hacking and specification gaming through constrained and structured learning. Intelligence is by its nature self-limiting, as it cannot pursue a reward without strategy or structure. Yet intelligence is also transgressive, as it cannot perpetually linger in a known set of constraints.

Beyond academia, as a restless spirit I try to avoid hobbies, but still have several interests: I am a competitive capoeirista and water polo player, and in my free time I enjoy science fiction, creative writing, and computer games. For everything else, feel free reach out to me directly. Εις το επανιδείν!
